newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: TAP shareholders called to approve new planes.
newsitem.headline: TAP shareholders called to approve new planes.

text.p: Portugal's state-owned airline TAP has called an extraordinary shareholders meeting for October 22 to approve the leasing of 22 new medium-haul planes, the Planning Ministry said on Friday.
Only after the meeting has approved the move, will the ministry announce which of two rival bidders -- U.S. group Boeing and European plane consortium Airbus Industrie -- has won the contract.
"So far no decision has been taken about the model of planes for the fleet. Negotiations are still in progress," the ministry said in a statement.
"After this formality (the shareholder meeting), the ministry will be in a position to decide and announce its decision," it added.
TAP's medium-haul fleet is currently made up of Boeing planes but according to press reports, Airbus is favourite to land the contract.
